comments.text:
Oh, some men in the comments. Women are so objectified in the media and in 
real life also, just look at the music videos and the magazine cover's of 
woman celebrities' "hot bikini bodies" or "shocking cellulite" etc. Woman 
nudity all over the rappers' (and in other genres') music videos, and the 
guys just sit there with their hoodies and caps, "like a boss", while the 
women just seem to be the decoration.
Some women choose to be strippers. And so do some guys, like the ones 
played in this movie. And who am I to judge them for their decisions?
But what makes me so fucking angry, is that when ONE mainstream movie (this 
right here), that has male strippers, come to theaters, and women enjoy 
watching it (I know I do), men start to whine about how objectifying it is.
Like, boo fucking hoo :DD﻿

This is disgusting! Half-naked men bumping and grinding to lascivious 
music. In fact, I had to watch this filth over and over again...for several 
hours...on a loop, just to comprehend how morally corrupt this is. I shall 
be protesting such bilge on it's release...inside the cinema and with a 
full box of salted popcorn and cheesy nachos. No point in being 
uncomfortable, whilst I voice my horror.﻿
comments.author: Lily Jo

comments.text:
Hahaha! Mama H is a very naughty woman. I have moved up and made space for 
her on the naughty step. Oh, and I think I may be in love with Mrs H.

I like pot bellies. There's something very comforting about hugging a man 
with a pot belly. Plus, I can rest my cup of tea on it if I can't be arsed 
to reach over to the coffee table.
comments.author: Lily Jo

comments.text:
I have been inform that I was infact incorrect. Mrs H has not read 50 
shades, only the first 20 pages.... My mother shall be joining you 
presently.
Mrs H is however - a feral beast when it comes to half naked men/vampires 
and/or Huge Jackman.
I thought it was the string vest thing, but alas, no. my pot belly poking 
out of what looks like an old bag of veg, is NOT alluring.

It's muscles what women like... bugger.
comments.author: Bumferry Hogart

comments.text:
Oh my Lord Mr H, I laughed so bloody hard, that I think I may have given 
myself a hernia!
Methinks Mrs H and your mother, need to join me on the naughty step.
comments.author: Lily Jo

comments.text:
Mrs H read that 50 shades book the other year and guess what she did...... 
go on guess..... I'll tell you what she did...... she lent it to my MOTHER!
My old ma then gave it back with some of the page corners folded over.

FOLDED OVER! 

we all know what that means.... My family are animals.
comments.author: Bumferry Hogart

comments.text:
Lately, I seem to have taken permanent residence upon the naughty step  Mr 
Z.
In truth, I'm not a fan of this 50 Shades malarky and I'm not one to fall 
for the hype surrounding a movie. But I am interested to see how such an 
awful book translates on the big screen...plus, I'm not the one paying, 
which is the most important thing.
